channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Area surrounding manhole damaged in heavy rain, 9th September
item.description:
During the heavy rain today, water has washed away the area around the manhole cover to expose large holes and also seems to have forced sewage out of this drain. This is on the footpath from the A435 near the roundabout with Sapphire Road leading to bramble chase off Finlay Way in bishops cleeve.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 30 Blackberry Grove, Bishops Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole lane one, 9th September
item.description:
Huge pothole between junction 10&11 northbound lane one. Closer to junction 11.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Lower Brookfield Farm Brookfield Road, Churchdown
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large amount of glass on pavement, 9th September
item.description:
Just outside church

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Greville House, 1 Morgans Drive, Cheltenham

item.title: Traffic cones left on park, 9th September
item.description:
Some lads left these two traffic cones on the park at the corner of Bibury Road and Robert Burns AVE a few days ago. They are by the planter.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 14 Bibury Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fibreoptics work causing chaos, 7th September
item.description:
Badly positioned traffic lights and lack of measures to ensure junctions are kept clear of parked cars has led to stand offs between vehicles travelling towards each other and I've witnessed minor road rage incidents. Car trying to turn into roads off Hesters Way Rd cannot get into those roads due to vehicles waiting to get out. I didn't witness peak time this morning with the schools being back but it was pretty bad at 9.30am! Better planning is needed!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 117 Hester's Way Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous work taking place, 7th September
item.description:
Fibre optics works are taking place but the barriers that are meant to protect the public are adding to the hazard rather than reducing it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 4 Beaumont Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A large hole has appeared close to the kerb outside of Ryman, 7th September
item.description:
This hole has only recently appeared and is potentially hazardous to anybody stepping from the pavement

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 33 Promenade, Cheltenham

item.title: Part of pavement cut out. Outside 33 and 35 Gristmill Close., 6th September
item.description:
Whoever is laying cables in Gristmill Close have left the hole in the pavement exposed. My daughter fell in it earlier today. Luckily she didnâ€™t hurt herself. This either needs filling in or covering over immediately.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 33 Gristmill Close, Cheltenham

item.title: Overhanging brambles, 6th September
item.description:
These brambles have been causing an issue with anyone walking past and especially young children. I have reported them to TBC twice now and nothing gets done.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 43 The Highgrove, Bishops Cleeve

item.title: Blind spot onto busy road, 6th September
item.description:
When exiting Vale Road onto Gotherington Lane it is impossible to see what is coming from the right - often at high speed. This is due to a hedge that impedes the view.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): White House Gotherington Lane, Bishops Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown brambles etc, 6th September

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Part Parcel 6460 Bushcombe Lane, Woodmancote

item.title: Bush/hedge overgrown, 6th September
item.description:

item.title: Numerous large potholes, 6th September
item.description:
These potholes have been in existence for over 6 months without any signs of repair. They are on a major cycling route so pose many dangers for cyclists using the road for exercise.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Withington
